Description: A series of fragments from the funerary papyrus of a man named Reri with vignettes and text in hieratic from the Book of the Dead.
Excavator/field collector: Field Collection by: William John Bankes
Curator's comments: Published: Mosher, The Papyrus of Hor, (2001), pl.24.4, 24.6, 27, p.81 n.35, p.91 n.82&88. Mosher, Malcom Jr. 2016. The Book of the Dead, Saite through Ptolemaic periods : a study of traditions evident in versions of texts and vignettes (SPBD Studies), vol. I (BD Spells 1-15) and II (BD Spells 16, 18-30), Charleston.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (57531) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/57531)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2012 July – September, Tokyo, Mori museum, The Book of the Dead: Journey Through the Afterlife 2012, October - November, Fukuoka Museum of Art, The Book of the Dead 2013, May - September, Perth, Western Australian Museum, The Book of the Dead
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: discoloured, loss Black ink Red ink Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: magic tape Binding: self adhesive tape Object Priority: A Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: A
